rectangle
=========

**Name**:

geom rectangle

**Description**:

Create a rectangle from the input geometry.

**Arguments**:

   * -w --width: The width

   * -h --height: The height

   * -p --numberOfPoints: The number of points

   * -r --rotation: The rotation

   * -c --center: The flag to use center (true) or the base (false)

   * -g --geometry: The input geometry

   * --help : Print help message



**Example**:::

    >>>geom rectangle -g "POINT (100 100)" -p 30 -w 500 -h 500

    POLYGON ((100 100, 171.42857142857144 100, 242.85714285714286 100, 314.2857142857143 100, 385.7142857142857 100, 457.14285714285717 100, 528.5714285714286 100, 600 100, 600 171.42857142857144, 600 242.85714285714286, 600 314.2857142857143, 600 385.7142857142857, 600 457.14285714285717, 600 528.5714285714286, 600 600, 528.5714285714286 600, 457.1428571428571 600, 385.7142857142857 600, 314.2857142857143 600, 242.85714285714283 600, 171.42857142857144 600, 100 600, 100 528.5714285714286, 100 457.1428571428571, 100 385.7142857142857, 100 314.2857142857143, 100 242.85714285714283, 100 171.42857142857144, 100 100))
